Description: Fragment of papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text. Writing on verso only, list of witnesses. Now joined with P BM EA 10442. P BM EA 10404 is the lower fragment, with the last 3 names of the list of 16 witnesses.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (probably (site suggested by Thompson's MS Catalogue))
Curator's comments: In set with P BM EA 10442. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.81, pl.67)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48645) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48645)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
